title: Measures of Length Act, 1889
description: Official consolidated text of Measures of Length Act, 1889 (II of 1889) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Title, extent and commencement
provisions.content:
(1) This Act may be called the Measures of
Length Act, 1889.
3
[(2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan]; and
4                 5
(3) It shall come into force on such day as the [Federal Government] may appoint in this
behalf.

provisions.title: Section 2. Standard yard. The imperial standard yard for the United Kingdom shall be the legal
provisions.content: standard measure of length in 2[Pakistan] and be called the standard yard.

provisions.title: Section 3. Measure for determining length of standard yard. A copy, approved by the

provisions.title: Section 4. Standard foot and inch. One
provisions.content:
third part of the standard yard shall be called a
standard foot, and one-thirty-sixth part of such a yard shall be called a standard inch.

provisions.title: Section 5. Presumption in favour of accuracy of certified measures. Any measure having stamped
provisions.content:
thereon or affixed thereto a certificate purporting to be made 1[before the first day of April, 1937,
under the authority of any Government in 2[Pakistan] or on or after that date under the authority of
the Provincial Government] and stating that the measure is of the length of the standard yard or that a
measure marked thereon as a foot or inch is of the length of the standard foot or standard inch, as the
case may be, shall, when produced before any Court by any public servant having charge of the
measure in pursuance of any direction published in an official Gazette 3[by order of the Provincial
Government], or by any person acting under the general or special authority of such a public servant,
be deemed to be correct until its inaccuracy is proved.

provisions.title: Section 6. Inspection of certified measures by the public. A public servant having in pursuance of
provisions.content:
such a direction charge of such a measure as is mentioned in the last foregoing section shall allow
any person to inspect it free of charge at all reasonable times and to compare therewith or with any
measure marked thereon any measure which such person may have in his possession.

provisions.title: Section 7. Certified measures to be kept by authorities required by existing enactments to keep
provisions.content:
measures of length. There shall be kept 4[* * *] by the District Magistrate under section 20 of
Regulation XII of 1827 of the Bombay Code, such certified measures of the standard yard, standard
foot and standard inch as are mentioned in section 5.
